intro: Alluaudia geayi, commonly known as the Madagascar star vine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing minute seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
